user_reviews.review_text: I put a bit of this in my homemade Chinese fried rice.. great taste! No damage in shipping and will buy again...quick shipping!!

user_reviews.review_title: PURE OYSTER LIQUOR SUPER DEAL and (PROBABLY) a HEALTH FOOD BONANZA - you know what they say...?
user_reviews.review_text: I'm surprised how much I ate within hours and this 5 pounder is going to be a regular post right next to the honey.Did you know that "oyster flavored" - read the label - means this is like the molasses of the oyster pot? And nothing else! Just no meat - so it's an extract of the oysters - and taste-tee! THANK YOU KIKOMAN for being the best available! SO BETTER THAN SOY SAUCE - NOTHING ADDED AT ALL.
I used to make the sauce for chicken lo mien and it was delicious. It came fresh and well packaged. Very happy with this purchase and will buy again.
Product arrived exactly as advertised. Taste good and makes a grey brown sauce.
I'm sure it isn't the most authentic oyster sauce but it's more economically practical and it's kikkoman, so I can rest assured it's gonna taste good.
I use it mostly in my cooking

user_reviews.review_title: Kikkoman Oyster Flavored Sauce-Red Label, 12.6 Ounce Tasts Great
user_reviews.review_text: I used this product to make several Korean dishes.  Kikkoman Oyster Flavored Sauce-Red Label, 12.6 Ounceadded the taste I needed in the recipe.I recommend this product.
Purchased to elevate our hibachi blackstone game. It did the job well. Came well packaged and adds that taste.

user_reviews.review_title: Taste like oyster sauce to me!
user_reviews.review_text: I decided to go with this large bottle because price per oz was cheaper than the little bottles in the store. Taste the same to me but definitely saved me money with the larger bottle. I wish they have this size for sesame oil and hoisin sauce!
If you like making American style Asian food at home, oyster sauce is a must-have item. This one tastes good and lasts a long time in the refrigerator.
Save a lot buying larger container & taste great
seasoning A+++
Makes my home cooked meals taste like restaurant quality but healthier. Glad a made the purchase.

I wanted oyster sauce, not flavored sauce, but I couldn't find any for sale.I bought Kikkoman oyster flavored sauce as I have used and liked their products in the past.NEVER again. This item is terrible tasting.I don't want to throw it out, so it will take a loooong time to get through it.The prior time I bought LKK Lee Kim Panda Oyster Flavored Sauce - 5 lb.It is better tasting than the rest.I finished the huge container within 2 weeks!

We live in South Carolina and have a hard time finding Asian foods. Walmart has Oyster Sauce in a tiny little bottle for like $5 - we can use that up in a week. Saw this on Amazon. Kikkoman is trusted brand, but I've never tried their Oyster Sauce before. It's Good. It says 5 lbs. but it's an 80 ounce plastic jug - that's 10 Cups for under $20 delivered. This will last a while and it does taste great.

I saw a YouTube video on making fried rice.  The cook recommended using oyster sauce.  He assured viewers that is doesn't taste like oysters.  It is a "yumcious", slightly thick, salty brown sauce. The background flavor is unidentifiable - it doesn't taste like chicken, lamb, beef, etc. It is something else but in the same meat family, not in the seafood family.  I used it on a wild rice stir fry.  I used about a tablespoon for 1.5 cups of rice.  It was delicious!  Next time though I will use a slightly smaller amount as I don't use a lot of salt on my food.  When you go to a Chinese restaurant and dishes are presented with a brown sauce that is indescribably delicious, I think that oyster sauce must be the base.  I'd always wondered how they made the sauce.  Secret uncovered - it's oyster sauce.  My husband has the palate of an 8 year old boy - meat and potatoes - he loved the chicken piece I made him try :)

Fried rice, lo mein, or use your imagination. Oyster sauce is a must add for many Asian flavored meals, when mixed with other Asian flavors such as soy and toasted sesame oil. Chinese restaurants tend to use spices sparingly but when your the chief at home add to taste for rich flavoring your sure to enjoy with every bite.
Great taste

I usually buy Lee Kum Kee brand of oyster sauce but this brand blows it out of water. This one is much more flavorful and makes my meals taste absolutely delicious. I refuse to buy the other brand and went searching for this brand. So glad I found it again.

user_reviews.review_title: Good.  Much better than other "oyster" sauces.
user_reviews.review_text: I dislike nothing.  There is nothing artificial or flavor enhancers in this...unless if you consider yeast to be a flavor enhancer.  Tasty!!It is difficult if not impossible to find oyster sauce or any oriental sauces that doesn't have flavor enhancers or msg, or stuff like gum and preservatives... totally unnecessary and make the sauce feel tacky and taste tacky.  These stuff ruins the sauces!I am glad that Kikkoman offer this version with no msg, as it offers one with msg as well.  Yay Kikkoman 👍
This stuff tastes awful.  I poured it own the drain.  Waste of money.  If I could give it 0 stars I would.

user_reviews.review_title: Oyster Sauce is my favorite ingredient of all time.
user_reviews.review_text: I cook and barbeque with it. It is the one thing I need more than salt. Makes everything taste better.
cooking

user_reviews.review_title: Best tasting Oyster Sauce I've ever had.
user_reviews.review_text: Quality product with rich taste and thickness unlike others. Love it!

This is the first time I have ever cooked with oyster sauce. It is so delicious, I put a teaspoon of this in fried rice, everyday for lunch during COVID, and it makes it taste absolutely amazing, especially with my green onion, garlic, ponzu, turmeric, egg, rice, sesame oil, fried rice. I eat this for lunch almost every work day.

As others have mentioned, I got 2 bottles oyster "flavored" sauce, NOT as depicted.  It was well wrapped, but the wrapping had an adhesive that removed half the writing on the bottle, so I can't read the ingredients.  Have not tried it yet, so can't opine on the taste.

user_reviews.review_title: It taste like a good oyster sauce Should
user_reviews.review_text: Chinese stir fries

user_reviews.review_title: Panic when I can't find it
user_reviews.review_text: I have been using Kikkoman oyster sauce for years.  It adds great flavor to many of the Asian dishes, I make.  For me it's one of the main ingredients.  I try to keep at least 3 bottles in pantry.  During the virus. I ran out of the oyster sauce, all big chain stores were wiped out.  Finally  I found small produce got 2 bottles, and my husband ordered on line with Amazon.  You want great taste (KIKKOMAN OYSTER SAUCE) the BEST.

user_reviews.review_title: What's not to love, it's Kikkomans?
user_reviews.review_text: I.ve never been disappointed with K. before. Can't wait to taste my next creation. Thanks for making this easy Amazon.
I bought this because my local store was out of my usual brand. It arrived damaged but after washing it off and refrigerating it it tastes delicious.
Taste good!
